explanation: probably from either জ্বলা (zola, “hot (taste), burning”) +‎ -অক (-ok, “adjectival suffix”) +‎ -ঈয়া (-ia, “adjectival suffix”) or জালুক (zaluk, “pepper”) +‎ -ঈয়া (-ia, “-ish, -y”).

katzer: Pebr, Pebr du, Pebr gwenn, Pebr glas

term: ငရုတ်ကောင်း

katzer: ພິກນ້ອຍ, ພິກໄທ
katzer tr: Mak phik thai, Phik noi, Phik thai

explanation: compound of കുരു (kuru) +‎ മുളക് (muḷakŭ), literally “seed chili”.

borrowed from Middle Persian [Book Pahlavi needed] (ʾp̄zʾl), [Book Pahlavi needed] (ʾp̄cʾl /abzār, abčār/, “instrument, tool; spice”), in Classical Persian افزار‎ (afzâr), اوزار‎ (avzâr), ابزار‎ (abzâr, “tool”), also in the sense of a marinade آچار‎ (âčâr), which serves another borrowing into the Arabic culinary regiolects as أَچَار‎‎ (ačār) ~ عُشَّار‎ (ʿuššār, “pickles”). Conflated with بِزْر‎ (bizr, “seed”), as if denoting seeds used for seasoning.
`Arabian pepper' (pilipili is just chili); 5. no evidence for borrowing?

katzer tr: Nalesham; Pho ba ril bu, Fowarilbu (writing uncertain)

explanation: a- (agent prefix) +‎ ta (to be peppery, to be spicy), literally `that which is peppery'
